Name: Hiyokomame
Description:
A game to learn how to eat with chopsticks. You pick up plastic chick peas from a bowl using chopsticks. Several small games (sorting, turning, etc) are described in the small booklet that also teaches you manners when eating with chopsticks.

The rules are all in japanese although a english translation exists.

Name: Bad Faeries
Description:
Subtitle: The Game of Faerie Combat

Publisher's description:

Does your garden suddenly look dry and wilted? Are you finding it hard to get new plants to take root and grow? You may think these are signs that insects or bad soil quality are at work but I must warn you it could be a sign something far more sinister is at work. Something you may have heard of. Faeries! There are those who want you to believe faeries are these cute, harmless little winged people who are only curious about humans. That belief could not be farther from the truth. Fairies are nothing more than selfish little addicts, whose sole desire in life is to suck the life right out of your garden. What you don't know is that a beautiful well tended garden is a place of magic and magic is what the evil little creatures are addicted to.

Welcome to Bad Faeries, the game of faerie combat. In Bad Faeries each player controls a mob of faeries fighting over a magical garden and the right to drain that garden of its life giving magic.

User summary:

Players build a mob of 200 points worth of fays, such as Brownie, Pixie, Leprechaun, Goblin, Nymph, etc.  Each fay type is rated for six attributes: Flit, Nimbleness, Wards, Wariness, Smacks, Being, and has a given cost.  A mob can be of mixed types, and you may have Brownies facing Brownies.

Once your mob is assembled, give them weapons and magic abilities.  The mobs then meet in combat to determine who rules the Garden.  Rules are provided for movement, ranged, melee and magical combat, wounds, terrain, morale and victory.

Name: JumpStart Alphabet Card Game
Description:
Frankie has dreamed up 12 words that use every letter of the alphabet.  To play, collect four cards that spell a word.  The cards are self correcting so that players will know when the set is complete.

With 3 levels of play to match your child's personal skills and grow with his or her development.

From the game rules, a summary of the three levels are:
Level 1-Find words and spell correctly
Level 2-Go fish with words
Level 3-"FRANKIE" game: Try not to be the last to notice that one player has a set of four.  Players touch their nose if they have a set of four, and everyone must touch their nose as soon as they see that someone else has.  If you are the last one who notices, you get a letter in the word FRANKIE.  If you get all of the letters, you lose.

Name: TSWW: Blitzkrieg
Description:
Blitzkrieg, by Diffraction Entertainment, is a MONSTER wargame to end all monster wargames. The map of Europe is phenomenal in its size, detail, and accuracy. It uses a scale of 1 hex is 15 miles! There are over 4,000 counters!!! It includes land, air, and naval units. As a bonus, the game can be broken down into smaller mini campaigns, very helpful when you haven't the table area for the full map!!! I was privileged to talk in detail with John Bannerman, one of the designers.

This is part of the blurb from the game's web site.

4480 counters covering the ground, naval and air forces of (in order of “appearance”): Germany, Poland, Great Britain and The Commonwealth, France, the Soviet Union, Denmark, Norway, The Netherlands, Belgium and Italy.  These are supported by a meticulously researched Order of Battle for the first year of the Second World War and include additional details for the United Kingdom and Germany until June 1941.

17 map sections (14” x 21½”) for a total of 35 sq ft of maps from North Cape to Bologna and Brest to Minsk at 15 miles per hex.  Laid out, the maps occupy an area of approximately 7’ x 6’ and have been created using digital mapping software developed in-house by Diffraction Entertainment.  Maps have been painstakingly digitised from period topographical maps in the 1:250,000 to 1:300,000 range.

The extensive Rule Set has been devised from the start as a standard for the entire game series including a framework for an exhaustive set of Political and Economic rules defining each nation’s operational parameters and special cases.  By the last game in the Second World War Series, these will have evolved into a detailed production model allowing players to explore different strategic options for the major combatants.
Multiple modules covering Poland (Stab in the Back), Scandinavia (Operation Weserübung), France 1940 plus The Battle of Britain (War in the West), and of course, Blitz!, a grand module to link all these together to cover the first year of the Second World War.
Ground unit values are derived from OLI formulas originally devised by Trevor N Dupuy, a methodology that allows many different weapon systems to be consistently rated then summed using the ground unit’s TO&E to give a theoretical operational combat value.  Differences in national capabilities of training, leadership, communications and other “soft” factors are simulated using a Combat Effectiveness Value (CEV) for each nation which is then used as a multiplier to the basic unit combat value.  CEV evolves for each nation during the war showing increasing competence for Allied forces and, after initial increases due to combat experience, a decreasing capability for German forces as manpower and unit TO&E’s degrade in capability.

Naval units down to destroyers are shown as individual ship counters with lesser ships and submarines depicted as flotillas.  Major liners also have individual counters so as to denote their special high-speed capabilities for transporting personnel.  The naval system utilises a naval zone approximately 75 miles wide superimposed on the 15 mile hex grid so that the unique properties of naval and air-sea interaction can be modelled simply but still keep the essential flavour of naval operations with brief bursts of high intensity operations.
Air Units are sized so that half units are available for carrier operations and have been rated by a bespoke system taking in to account a large number of performance parameters.  To reflect the attritional nature of air operations, air replacements are required to be expended just to keep forces in operation in addition to replacing combat losses.  Emphasis has been placed in the rules to encourage historical missions rather than wholesale commitment of airpower to offensive and defensive close air support.
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: Tourist Traps
Description:
Tourist Trap is a card game where you see how many vacations you can complete before you run out of money. But beware, the tourist traps want their share of your vacation money too.

This family card game is played by placing mileage cards on different destinations. Once a destination is completed and the player returns home they get the points on that card. While traveling, others may play Tourist Trap cards which will actually cost the player even more of their vacation cash.

Source: [The Game Crafter, LLC].

Name: Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game
Description:
(From the official site)

The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Board Game — a fast-paced game of skill, strategy, knowledge and luck that the entire family will enjoy playing. The game contains hundreds of fascinating trivia questions about the greatest and fastest game on Earth. Have hours of family fun trying to guess the identities of the greatest hockey legends of all time. The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game is an authoritative masterpiece of trivia and a who’s who of hockey, as well as a tribute to the greatest players who ever played and those still playing the game. The Official Hockey Hall of Fame Game can be played over and over again by fans of all ages.

Name: Het Grote Bruid & Bruidegom Spel
Description:
A marriage themed trivia game.

Each player gets a marriage certificate card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the marriage certificate card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the marriage certificate card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Verjaardagsspel
Description:
Each player gets a birthday card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the birthday card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the birthday card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Sudoku Spel
Description:
Players try to complete a Sudoku puzzle.

The first player tries to solve the puzzle. After 2 minutes the player passes the puzzle to the next player. Now that player has the chance to solve the Sudoku. 
After 8 minutes the game ends. The player which filled in the most answers correctly wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Etiquette Spel
Description:
Each player gets a survey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the survey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the survey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Witchcraft
Description:
Story
The Academy of Magic is a place where disciples of magic learn the art of magic.

Recently, mysterious cases have occurred, cases in which students and teachers have been brutally murdered.

These murders correspond to a legend that exists at the Acadamy regarding the conduct of a particular witch. Repeated tragedies at the Acadamy have made people aware that the legend of the existence of the 'Witch of the Acadamy' may indeed be true.

To get rid of the witch, 5 members of academy start the research about the  legend of the Witch.

The aim of the members of this group  is to find and to get rid of the witch.

By the way, the legend also says that the witch can transform into whomever the witch has killed.

This means there is always a question about,  if one of the research members is already a witch.
  
Humans have their own magic which is different from magic users from far beyond the beginning of the academy. This magic is called "information"...

The frightful magic of the 'Witch of the Academy' can celebrate the murderer as a saint, and can execute a bonny innocent  girl as a witch.

About this game

You become one of the 5 possible characters, and by gathering information about the witch, you try to contribute to the research and to become the most reliable character.

Also you must pay attention to the possibilities that one of the members is actually a witch, you may point out a member as a witch.

(In this game, you must discard a field card and take a field card.)

Discarded character card gives you information, while you point out a character as a witch by taking cards.


To tell the truth, there may be no witch amongst the members of the group. However, a character who is pointed out as being the witch may lose the trust of the rest of the players in the game and  may be executed.

So it is important to gather information, but at the same time it is important to cast doubt on the other characters by spreading witch rumors, or by trying to avoid being accused of being the witch yourself.  The winner is the person who survives the swirling eddy of information and misinformation surrounding the Witch Distrubance.

Name: Het Grote Film & Muziek Spel
Description:
Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Kerst Spel
Description:
A christmas themed trivia game.

Each player gets a christmas card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the christmas card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the christmas card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Spel: Culinair
Description:
Each player gets a menu card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and moving the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the menu card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the menu card.

When a player gets a correct answer for a category that he/she already had the Right-chip for, he/she may choose another player who also has a Right-chip for that category and force the other player to turn the chip over to its Wrong-side.

Whenever one of the players has collected chips for every category (it doesn't matter if they are Right or Wrong), the game ends and the player with the most Right-chips (correct answers) is the winner. In case of a draw the game continues until one player has the most Right-chips.

Name: Het Grote Puzzel & Crypto Spel
Description:
Each player gets a puzzle card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the puzzle card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the puzzle card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Het Grote Oranje Spel
Description:
A Trivia game themed with the Dutch monarchy.

Each player gets a monarchy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the monarchy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the monarchy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Anarchy
Description:
from the publisher's website

Anarchy may be described as a fast and furious parody of trick-taking games, the point being that you all play at once instead of going through the laborious and time-consuming process of taking turns - which of course is undemocratic, conferring an unearned privilege on whoever goes first, and being therefore suitable only for the decadent entertainment of a hierarchic-élitist society.

Each player chooses a card and then they are all flipped at the same time. The player with the highest card of each suit wins the other cards of that suit that were also played during that hand. If there is only one of a suit, it is compared to the other individual cards and the player with the highest card collects them all.

At the start of the turn, you must decide what you are playing for. You can try and simply collect the most cards or go for a specific color, suit or the least amount of cards. The more specific you option the more points you get at the end of the round, which occurs once all cards have been played.

The game is played to a specific amount of points and once a player reaches that number, they are declared the winner.

The current rules for the game include the variants Anarchist Bomb, which has more bids and the role of the Anarchist, and Organized Chaos which has a fixed 10-round structure in which each player must make each bid once.

Name: Gormiti: The Trading Card Game
Description:
From back of box...

Our world is threatened by the Volcano Gormiti, frightening creatures from the parallel dimension of Gorm. Four adolescents will face the elemental monsters and ally with the Gormiti of Earth, Forest, Air and Sea. Transforming into Super Gormiti, Toby, Nick Jessica and Lucas are going to Gorm to try and save the Earth!

Inspired by the animation series of the same name, Gormiti: The Trading Card Game sees the different factions of the Island of Gorm face each other in epic battles!

Live out the battles of titans in a parallel universe!

Gormiti is a Trading Card Game for two players. The goal is to deplete all of your opponents energy orbs by attacking them with monsters that you play each turn. 
Players construct their own deck of cards from their collections and use them to battle each other. Each turn you can recruit new beasts and attack your opponent with monsters you have played previously.
When battling you opponent may block your attacker with one of their monsters from their defence zone. Compare your attack stat to the defenders resistance stat and see who wins. If you attack and are unopposed then you destroy one of your opponents energy orbs. Destroy 5 or 6 (depending on who went first) and you win.

Name: Munchkin Dice Of Protection
Description:
The Munchkin Dice of Protection is a pair of 6-sided dice.

				
				
					From the package


    
         You may start a game of Munchkin with up to two Munchkin d6 Dice.Place the first die on an Item you have in play. That Item can not be stolen, lost, sold, etc. unless you allow it.

When you roll to Run Away, roll the second one. If your roll is equal to the value of the first die, you may escape automatically be sacrificing the Item underneath it. Discard it.

    


				
				
					UnofficialThese dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Munchkin Booty D6 Dice
Description:
The Munchkin Booty D6 Dice is a pair of 6-sided dice that were sold by themselves and in the Munchkin Booty Dice Set with a Munckin Booty Dice Bag, and a single Munchkin Booty D10 Dice.

				
				
					From the Munchkin Booty D6 Dice package


    
         If you use this die in a game of Munchkin Booty:[Hide the Booty]

At the end of your turn you may place cards underneath your Hide Away. You can hide a number of cards equal to your level.

These card are now considered out of the game for all purposes. You may retrieve any of them at any time during your turn, except during combat.

If you lose levels discard a random card from these for each level you lose.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.

    


				
				
					From the Munchkin Booty Dice Set package


    
         If you use this D6 die in a game of Munchkin Booty:If you are a pirate without a Ship, you may at any time during your turn, except during combat, take a Ship from the discard pile.

Place the die on the Ship. The Ship now has a value worth 0 Gold Pieces, but the die grants a combat bonus equal to your level. The die and the ship can be lost as any other ship.

In any other game of Munchkin the die acts as a Cheat card. Remove the die from the game after using it.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.

    


				
				
					UnofficialThese dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Munchkin Booty D10 Dice
Description:
The Munchkin Booty D10 Dice is a single 10-sided die that was sold by itself and in the Munchkin Booty Dice Set with a Munckin Booty Dice Bag, and a pair of Munchkin Booty D6 Dice.

				
				
					From the Munchkin Booty D10 Dice package


    
         If you use this die in a game of Munchkin Booty:If you are a pirate without a Ship, you may at any time during your turn, except during combat, take a Ship from the discard pile.

Place the die on the Ship. The Ship now has a value worth 0 Gold Pieces, but the die grants a combat bonus equal to your level. The die and the ship can be lost as any other ship.

In any other game of Munchkin the die acts as a Cheat card. Remove the die from the game after using it.

The rules for Muchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.

    


				
				
					From the Munchkin Booty Dice Set package


    
         If you use this D10 die in a game of Munchkin Booty:[Hide the Booty]

At the end of your turn you may place cards underneath your Hide Away. You can hide a number of cards equal to your level.

These card are now considered out of the game for all purposes. You may retrieve any of them at any time during your turn, except during combat.

If you lose levels discard a random card from thse for each level you loose.

The rules for Munchkin Dice & Wicked Munchkin Dice do not apply to this die.

    


				
				
					UnofficialThese dice were not properly licensed through Steve Jackson Games and were recalled almost immediately. They cannot be used in official Munchkin games.

				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Football
Description:
Football is played on 30x18 squares field. Each player has 11 players and there are 2 stacks of cards you need when a player enters a red or blue field.

Players choose the duration of the match (2x45' is suggested in the gamerules).
Each player determines the placing of his team, according to the normal rules of football.

In your turn you roll 1 normal and 1 special die. The normal die indicates how far you can advance 3 of your players. The special die indicates the direction they can run.

The player with most goals wins.

Name: Mission to Ecuador
Description:
Mission to Ecuador is an entertaining and competitive card game of strategy for two to four players. Mission to Ecuador duplicates some of the real effort and uses some inspirational biblical verses required to establish a working mission as based on an actual mission to Ecuador.

Source: [ The Publisher Website].

Players take turns drawing cards until a mission card is played. At that point players stop drawing cards and start playing their convert cards that match the played mission. When a player can no longer play a convert card the mission ends and all players who placed convert cards places them face down in their "good works" pile. The player with the most "good works" when the deck runs out wins.

Name: Jukebox Trivia
Description:
Back of the box

Guess the names of pop songs, the bands or artists who sang them and what lyrics belong where. The all new Jukebox Trivia card game is available in three versions: Novice for those who don't have a clue who Michael Jackson is, Intermediate for those who know every Madonna song ever released and Expert for those who consider themselves musical Einsteins!

Name: Tannhäuser: Reich Troop Pack
Description:
The Reich Troop Pack for Tannhäuser includes two additional Schocktruppen and Stossstruppen figures. These figures feature an alternate color scheme making it easy for players to differentiate their new troops from the ones in the core game.

These Troop Packs give players new options when constructing their forces, and provide an all new pack for their Troops! Each pack also features brand new flavor text, a unique scenario, and all new tokens for the new Troopers as well as the ones found in the core set.

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of Tannhäuser is required to play.

Name: Tannhäuser: Union Troop Pack
Description:
From Fantasy Flight Games Website

The Union Troop Pack for TannhÃ¤user comes with two additional Commando Alpha and Commando Delta figures. These figures feature an alternate color scheme making it easy for players to differentiate their new troops from the ones in the core game.

These Troop Packs give players new options when constructing their forces, and provide an all new pack for their Troops! Each pack also features brand new background information, a unique scenario, and all new tokens for the new Troopers as well as the ones found in the core set.

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of TannhÃ¤user is required to play.

Name: Munchkin Boxes of Holding
Description:
Munchkin Boxes of Holding are designed to hold cards from any of the many Munchkin games as those cards are a non-standard size. Each box can hold 500 cards, with one box for Door cards and one box for Treasure cards. Three themed versions of the Boxes of Holding exist – one based on basic Munchkin, another based on Munchkin Cthulhu, and a third based on Munchkin Zombies; each version is packaged with two unique cards for the corresponding Munchkin set.

Munchkin Boxes of Holding Set 2 changes this formula by including a third box large enough for all the Dungeon cards released as of mid-2013 and the Seals from Munchkin Apocalypse, with room to spare for other items still to come. This set also includes three new unique cards, one of which will be a Dungeon.

Part of the Munchkin series.

Name: Ara
Description:
Ara is a game of strategy, diplomacy, and, economics. The game was created to be a strategy game that balances economic and military competition.

You must gather resources while building an army to conquer other nations on a planet of the future.  There are three different units you may purchase: Mobs, Hovertanks, and Ships. The attack mechanic is dice based where certain numbers score casualties, and casualty shots are taken. There is a track around the outside of the board that you go around for the purpose of a random event generator as well as a time keeper, as you cycle through seasons where you may either only build or only gather resources

Name: Gizoomie
Description: Gizoomie is a dice game where people try to be the person with the Gizoomies worth the most points when the game ends!  On their turn, players roll two dice.  One die tells what color Gizoomie to do something with, while the other tells what to do with that Gizoomie: pass left, pass right, take from the pot, put into the pot, take 1 from anywhere, or take both.  Each color Gizoomie has one large Gizoomie and one small Gizoomie.

Name: Avoid the 10!
Description:
A dice game in which you roll 5 dice three times, setting one aside each time, trying to get the highest score possible.  If your total is over 10, then you get points worth the difference between your score and 10.  However, if your total is less than 10, you get points equal to three times the difference between your total and 10.  If your total is 10, you are out of the game!

However, there's one more twist: of the five dice, two are normal dice marked 1-6, two are trick dice marked with three 2s and three 6s, and the last die has a 5 on every face.  This contributes to some interesting strategies as you try to maximize your points but avoid the dreaded 10!

First to reach 99 points exactly wins!

Name: Portito
Description:
User Summary: The game is played by rolling five dice, and setting aside aside at least one scoring dice after each role, rolling only the dice that aren't kept for as long as the player keeps scoring.  If, at any point, no dice rolled score, then all points set aside in that turn are lost, and the dice passed to the next player.  Following any roll in which at least one dice scores, the active player may 'bank' the points accumulated that turn, and pass the dice to the next player.  The next player then has the option of building on that score by rolling only the non-scoring dice, or picking up all five dice and starting from zero.  At any time, the active player may call 'portito', which has the effect of flipping all dice following the roll: 1s become 6s, 2 become 5s, etc.  The player remains 'portito' until calling 'normal', which they can only do when the dice are in their possession (so you remain 'portito' while the dice go round the players).  The game continues until one player exactly reaches some pre-determined target score: 5000 or 10000 is common.

Scoring dice within each roll are as follows:
1 = 100 points
5 = 50 points
3 of a kind = dice score * 100

Name: Keks
Description:
"Keks" is the German word for "cookie, cracker"; actually it's derived from "cakes", yet "Keks" is singular.

Keks is a tile removal game for 2 players. It's designed for nestorgames' game system Nestortiles.

To play this little game arrange all 60 tiles in a square of 8x8 leaving out the corners (this is the "keks").

If it's your turn, break off any same-color tiles that have at least 2 open edges. But never break the whole keks into pieces! Each tile is worth one point, except the very first tile of a certain color, which counts zero points. As soon as you collect 3 same-color tiles (of value), you won that color, except for the very first color, which is won in the game. This color counts - again - zero points.

You win the game by winning the fifth color.

Happy keksing!

Name: Power Grid: Russia & Japan
Description:
Two new expansion maps for Power Grid: Russia on one side and Japan on the other.

In Russia, the market for power plants is restricted. Additionally, the standard rules for exchanging out-of-date power plants are changed, forcing the leading players to completely rethink their strategies.

In Japan, based on the crowded geographical surroundings, the players can start two separate networks. The first connections are restricted to certain cities, guaranteeing a tough fight for the best networks.

Name: PBC: The Pro Baseball Chronology
Description:
The baseball game which spans the entire history of pro baseball.


     Features Every pro team from 1871 to the present is rated. All players, regardless of their playing time, are included. All batters and pitchers are individually carded. Each batter is rated for: Overall batting ability, propensity to get on base, to strike out, to hit into double plays, to hit singles, doubles, triples & homers, to draw walks, to be hit by pitches, to attempt base steals, and base stealing success. Each batter card also gives the number of games the player appeared in along with the team stint. This is included for those of you wishing to conduct realistic player transactions during a season. Each pitcher is rated for: Overall pitching ability, propensity to keep runners off the bases, to give up hits, to walk batters, to strike out batters, to throw wild pitches, to hit batsmen and to commit balks. Each pitcher card also included the number of games the pitcher appeared in, along with the number of games he appeared as a starter. As with the batting cards, a team stint number is also included.


Each team has its own fielding chart, with each position player listed, along with the positions he played, the number of games in which he appeared in that position, his error rating for that position, and his throwing arm rating (if he is an outfielder.)

Unique control system controls the flow of the game. You will get a visual picture of the batter/pitcher duel as each at-bat is conducted. The great hurlers will generally control the game, but a weak batter will surprise the ace at any moment!

Fast action cards included, ready for printing. You may print them 1 or 2-sided. Additional game charts include out charts, extra charts and missing data charts (for those years where statistics were not available.) Game playing time is about an hour.

Name: Kaispeicher
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

With Kaispeicher, there will be even more to do between the warehouses and channels of The Speicherstadt. This expansion adds new wares and cards to the game, including not only new buildings, orders and ships, but also several actions that will allow you to gain an advantage or make life difficult for your opponents. There is also a new figure for each player, which – in conjunction with the new auction mechanism – will add a whole new level of tactical options.

This expansion includes 25 real metal coins, bringing even more life to the busy port city of Hamburg!

Name: Wrath of Gods
Description:
Wrath of Gods is an area control game set in ancient Greece where players take on the role of Gods (Ares, Poseidon, Aphrodite, and Artemis) in an effort to gain enough control over the people to overthrow Zeus. Each god in the game has unique powers and interacts with the game in different ways. Players will use these powers to try and gain control over the people, and build temples and fortresses for themselves to help solidify their victory.

The game is played over a series of rounds, in which players will simultaneously select one of their available action cards, and then execute them. Playing action cards costs the players wrath, which is the main resource in the game. While enslaving, converting, and battling your opponents followers can gain you the precious tribute and points you need to win the game, doing so will increase the other players' wrath, making their ability to respond that much more powerful.

- User Summary

Name: Dixit 2: "Gift" Promo Card
Description:
This is a promo card that was given out with some of the pre-order customers for Dixit 2.  Copies of this promo were also given away at GenCon 2010.

This expansion is one card that expands your Dixit and Dixit 2 games by being added to the deck of cards.  This picture shows a boy sitting on a pile of presents/gifts.  A girl standing on the floor in front of the pile is holding out a gift in different colored wrapping paper in her hands.

Name: Slappy Hands
Description:
Slappy Hands is a fun and unique dexterity game.  Each person has a “sticky hand”.  The hand is a small rubber hand that has a sticky film on it attached to a cord (actually all one piece of rubber).  A chip is placed in the middle of the table with the participants sitting on each side of the table.  Once someone says go, you try to grab the chip from the table with your sticky hand.  Once a chip is plucked from the table, that person scores one point and another chip is placed and it starts again.  Normally, the winner is the first to five points.  Certain chips can be worth two points adding extra incentive in grabbing that chip.

- from co-designer

Name: Crossbows and Catapults: Grand Battleset
Description:
From the back of the box:

'In the Dark Ages, enemy kingdoms battled using the powerful crossbow and the mighty catapult... The battlefields is now being readied for the clash between the Vikings and the Barbarians.  You are the commander of the Vikings and your opponent is the commander of the Barbarians.  Both commanders have great arsenals of weapons and brave warriors, but the one who possesses the greater skill and better strategy will conquer!'

This expansion adds large, square, towers with integral catapults and spring loaded roof platforms.  A direct hit on the front gate will propel any defenders positioned on the spring loaded roof platform into the air.

This expansion also contains (for each side): 
12 interlocking wall blocks, 
8 defending soldiers, 
14 additional reinforcement battle caroms for use with either crossbows or catapults, 
1 King battle carom, 
5 flags to delineate territory
catapult 
crossbow
tower
base platform.

There's enough here to play independently of the main game, but once added to the original set, players have the capability to create epic battlefields.

Players must set up their allocated forces at each end of the playing area, then do their best to smash, bash and destroy their opponent's fortifications and forces by using the elastic-band powered siege machines.

Catapults fire indirectly, lobbing pucks over obstacles, to strike deep inside their opponent's base.  While crossbows fire directly, destroying everything in their path.

Fun for both kids and adults.

Name: Yatzy Junior
Description: Yatzy Junior is childrens variant on the classic dice game played with 5 dice. Instead of the usual 13 categories there are only 10. Apart from the 6 categories for the different sides of the dice (sun, moon, apple, lemon, heart and cat), there is 2 pair, full house, 5 different sides and Yatzy.

Name: Luring Royalty
Description:
Royalty are scattered about the provinces and you, as queen, bring them to your kingdom. Gather up resources to lure in the nobles before your rivals do the same. The kingdom with the most prestige will rule the provinces!

Luring Royalty is a card game, requiring 2 standard decks of playing cards, for two to four players.  The four jokers and one suit per player are used (eg. in a 3 player game, one suit of cards is removed so that you have just three suits).  The cards are split into a Resource deck (Aces and 2-10) and a Royalty deck (Jacks, Queens, Kings, Jokers).  Each player selects a suit and starts the game with a queen of that suit.

Three royalty cards are always available and each royalty card will have up to 7 resource cards in its row.  The rightmost resource card may be added to a player's hand for free and other resource cards and royalty cards may be picked up by paying 2 resources per card to the right of the card being purchased.

When the royalty draw pile is expired, the game ends and players compare total prestige points.  Points are earned as follows: 1 Point per Resource card of your suit; 1 Point for the 1st Jack; 2 Points per Queen; 3 Points per King; 4 Points per Joker; 6 Points per 2nd, 3rd, ... Jack; +4 Points per Queen & King of same suit; +1 point per Two Jacks of the same suit

Luring Royalty was designed and created for the Design Contest Entries: Traditional Card Games for Two Players run by Sean Ross (I).

Version 2 Rules Update (2010): Changed King/Queen bonus from +3 to +4
Version 3 Rules Update (2012): Use 2 resource cards with the same number for a purchase value of 12
Version 4 Rules Update (2016): Added Two Jacks of same suit bonus of +1; Allow gaining rightmost resource card for free with resource cards purchase
Version 5 Rules Update (2017): Players start with Queens instead of Kings; Changed 2nd, 3rd, ... Jack scoring value from 5 to 6 points

Name: BattleTech: Hexpack – Lakes and Rivers
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

More Terrain for the Battlefield!

You've defeated your opponent across all the terrain that the BattleTech Introductory Box Set has to offer and now you want more worlds to conquer. Grab your dice and start rolling, because this product is for you!

HexPack: Lakes and Rivers is a flexible map system aid for the BattleTech game system. Designed for use in conjunction with other pre-printed mapsheets (such as those from the Introductory Box Set), the system’s flexibility allows for easy modifications to existing mapsheets, increasing the enjoyment of a given scenario as players quickly change the terrain to bring new excitement to each game they play! A booklet contains two ready-to-play scenarios, which include expanded play options such as clearing woods, buildings and additional weather conditions.

Contents:

-One 18″ x 22″ full-color gameboard-quality mapsheet, with a different map printed on either side.
-Four punch-out-and-ready-to-play gameboard-quality HexTile sheets.
-Sixteen page booklet.

Miniatures not included.

Name: Dice War
Description:
Dice war is a two player game played with 33 six sided dice in a similar version of the classic card game WAR.

The object of the game is for a single player to capture his opponents 16 dice.

There is a single die that is also used as a "Miss" roll.  This miss roll comes into play and makes the dice odds a little different on how you would actually capture the opponents die. (This is all explained in the Word Document Rules).

This is a simple but fun game for folks who like rolling dice.

You can also substitute the type of dice you play with for other variations of the game.

Name: Cutthroat Caverns Adventures: B1 – Savage Arena  /  B2 – Errand of Evil
Description:
This is a second Adventure Module for Cutthroat Caverns that uses a 'choose-your-own-path' style book to overlay an exciting new dimension to the game. The first such book was introduced in the boxed expansion, Tombs and Tomes, and features a fun narrative in which characters have to make real decisions that will affect the outcome of the story, solve riddles, overcome traps, encounter familiar creatures in a whole new way -- and, importantly, will face new winning and/or losing conditions. The result is a slightly longer, but richer gaming experience.

The book comes with two all new Encounter Cards exclusive to this adventure, but fully usable in the core game as well. The Encounters are new 'Boss' type encounters that, when discovered in the core game's Encounter deck, will do something 'bad' to the party before being placed at the bottom of the stack to be faced as the final encounter.

The Adventures:
Savage Arena...
You and your party of adventurers are chained, neck to neck, as prisoners of Big Boss Gronkk. You must work together to survive a lethal coliseum of traps and monsters before the strongest among you earns the right to win your freedom.

Errand of Evil...
Your mysterious employer sends you to the stronghold of his rival to steal everything you can, for among his treasures is the one relic that can restore his misshaped body. The relic can change form, so you need to bring all you find -- but will his secret be your undoing?
(NOTE: If you can avoid it, don't read the Encounter card before the end of this book - for maximum fun and impact!!)

The book utilizes materials from the base game as well as Tombs and Tomes and Relics and Ruins. All materials are provided in the book if you do not own those expansions. (Copy the cards before playing - especially for Errand of Evil)

Name: Brushfire
Description:
A miniatures wargame set in a version of Earth with animal-based countries. From Napoleonic France populated by burrowing mammals, to an Ottoman Empire founded by reptilian nomads, Brushfire continues to follow our Legendary Realms roleplaying mentality with an indepth hero and army development system, as well as a complex Campaign design. (Publisher Blurb)

The game features a unique and interesting system using 10 sided dice instead of the classic 6 sided.  This creates new dynamics as well as new odds to master.  In addition, the game has three different kinds of points by which to buy your army.  This creates a very different feel than most war games, as an army feels like an army, not all heroes or all infantry.  Finally, the game uses and RPG-like style of hero creation, where a player is given so many hero levels, which can be used to buy skills on a skill tree.  Overall this makes for an original and fascinating game.

Name: Dino Dig Challenge: Dinosaur Bone Excavation Game
Description:
Dino Dig Challenge from Uncle Milton is a Battleship style game.
From the blurb on the back of the box "You're on a dinosaur dig, and the stakes are high. If you find all your opponent's Velociraptor bones, you win the game. Easy? Think again! You'll need to avoid dangerous tar pits as you build your Velociraptor with the excavated bones! The first player to excavate and build a complete Velociraptor wins!"

Players take turns to try to discover dinosaur bones using the same A-J, 1-10 grid references as Battleship. Key differences are that the bones do not have target points which consist of a single straight line and that the bones have preset positions to fit onto four 5x5 terrain tiles. Don't be fooled though, this preset position rather than destroying the game, as I expected actually makes it far more of a logical deduction game than a guess fest.

BTW the blurb about dangerous tar pits is just blurb. The game rules do not mention any tar pit effect.

Name: Boojum
Description: Boojum is a set collection card game, using auction and deck building mechanics. It uses two decks of Decktet cards, plus some tokens to keep score. Groups of cards are auctioned, with players bidding using other cards from their hand. The winning bid for each group gets incremented by a card, and then auctioned in the next round. Sets to be collected are typical rummy/poker-like sets: straights, sets, flushes, etc., plus a few sets peculiar (in at least two senses of the word) to the Decktet. A sister game to Snark which uses the same mechanics, but with a Rainbow Deck.

Name: Malifaux: Rising Powers
Description:
User Summary

Released at GenCon 2010, Malifaux - Rising Powers adds more options to your scraps and brawls. New strategies and schemes give your crews more to fight over.  New masters and minions are added to every faction to expand your crews.  C. Hoffman brings his machines to the guild. Collete entertains Malifaux while running soulstones for the Arcanists.  Kirai seeks vengeance upon those who have wronged her for the Ressurectionists.  The Dreamer and his buddy Lord Chompy Bits bring their might to the Neverborn.  Hamelin, changed by the plague, adds more power to the Outcasts.  Now, you also have the option to lead your crew with henchmen, slightly weaker models with a narrower unit selection, but ooze in flavor.  Ophelia and her ragtag group of gremlins bring even more terror to the bayou.  More masters, more minions, more options.

Name: Funny Little Wars
Description:
Subtitle: Being In The Main a Preoccupation For The Better Sort of Chap, & Making Full Use of Classic Toy Soldiers (Which The Pedants Call "54mm")

Publisher's description:

Written in part as a tribute to HG Wells ground breaking  Little Wars , FLW is a much expanded and broadened modernization. There is a fascinating chapter devoted to Wells the Man and his journey with his "Little Wars" from inception to the day in 1916 when he put the game away for good. For fans of Wells' work, The Padre may surprise you with information you did not know, or could even guess.

Retaining many of Wells' original rules (such as the use of spring-loaded toy cannon), there are now additional rules for Shell Bursts, machine guns, observation balloons and aircraft, field hospitals, supply wagons and dumps, spies, military bands, unit Colors and Standards, Brigade up to Division Commands, hidden movement, skirmishers, snipers, unpredictable effects of terrain, signals, morale, and much more.

Infantry units are a standard 20 figures strong, Cavalry 12, and Artillery can appear as single Guns with crews, or as Batteries of up to three strong. From two to four such units, with a Battery, typically form a Brigade, the perfect command for each Player. Two or more Brigades form a Division, and this is the post for the Player who will act as Commanding Officer for his side.

Each Brigade and the Divisional HQ is represented by a variable number of Staff and ADC's, marching on foot, mounted on prancing steeds, or even seated in Rolls Royce, Cadillac, Renault, or other grand Staff Cars from the Golden Age of Motoring. From these HQ's must come the orders to the units on the firing line, but the traffic isn't all one way! Back to the Brigadiers and the Commanding General, come the reports of the scouts--and the desperate messages from the front lines delivered by Runners, Gallopers, and even Pigeons! There is far more skill than luck required to lead your miniature minions to victory, and the rules provide this without complicated systems. In many respects, there is far less abstraction in Funny Little Wars in the spaces of your garden than there is on the traditional table top.

While designed for yard games, the rules can be played on the floor or table top. Figures used can range from antique and modern "Collectibles," to readily available plastics. Included are detailed lists for 14 different Armies identified by their "Colors," ("Army Red," "Army Black," "Army Red/Gold," etc) with complete information on how to build your favorites. Each Army has its unique strengths and weaknesses, and a personality which will definitely suggest its historical counterpart.

Much as Wells' rules did, FLW covers the quarter century prior to WW I, when war was still romantic, the uniforms were dashing, and the Generals still waltzed. This is the very era that gave birth to the Military Pentathalon, and a player may find himself having to excel in one or more of its challenges to deliver a crucial dispatch! Padre Paul's rules reflect the late Victorian and Edwardian spirit in both the substance of the rules and the delightful style of his writing. Designed for "The Better Sort of Chap," the book contains suggestions for proper Dress during the game, etiquette on the field, and more. Nor are the Ladies and "Girls of the better sort" forgotten. The Padre's Wife, Georgina, provides a charming account of a "proper dinner" served after an especially Gentlemanly game at Dover Castle one recent Summer.

Not only are there the Basic Rules, but many Optional Rules allowing players to set their own levels of play. There are lists of providers of toy soldiers in every price range, as well as all manner of accessories, and recommendations on how to shop inexpensively on the Internet for those items you will not find so readily in the stores. Sections describe how to set up a yard, park, rockery, beach, or other site to be your Battlefield. For once, you WILL have room to perform that wide flanking maneuver! Light Cavalry and Infantry come into their own, screening your forces while trying to detect your enemy's. Once more, War Gaming is as much fun as when any of us discovered the hobby, no matter how many years--or decades!--ago.

Rules for basing figures are flexible and encourage players to work with what is best for their needs. And while comprehensive, there are no complex rules or formulae, and nothing more than traditional six-sided dice are required--besides measuring tapes and a beautiful day under the shade of the trees. Childlike, but never "Childish," FLW goes back to the Hobby's roots, and even our own as we play once more with the toy soldiers so many us first had as kids.

Name: 3D Block Game
Description:
The game has 18 "Tetris"shaped blocks and a little square boardgame, 3 hexes by 3.
The game also comes with an electronic buzzer.

When it's your turn, you press the buzzer.  The buzzer will tell you which block you have to take, this by describing the colour of the block.
You take that block and put it on the board, when you did that, you push the buzzer again, which will tell the next player which block he has to pick and place.  
When putting the block on the board you only have a certain amount of time (8, 10 or 12 seconds).

By putting the blocks on the board you'll create a tower, when it's your turn you must succeed putting the block on the board or on another piece already placed on the board and by doing so trying not to turn over the tower.
If the tower falls, that player is excluded from the game.

You play on untill there's one player left.

source: user summary

Name: Snark
Description:
A set collecting deck-building auction game, using the Rainbow Deck. A sister game to Boojum, which uses the same mechanics but with a Decktet.

Players bid on groups of cards to make sets of various descriptions. The bids are cards from the players' hands, which then get added to and become the lots for the next round of auctions. There are different types of sets to collect from familiar poker/rummy type sets like straights, flushes and full houses, to rainbow deck specific letter-based sets. The first player to collect one of each of the six set type tokens is the winner.

Name: Tijdstrijd
Description:
Co-operative trivia game on history, mainly Belgian and European.

Players move their pawns through six different periods in history. For each move he makes, the active player must answer a question about that period. When answered correctly he draws a token (mostly hour glasses) and gains one point on the players' mutual life scale. For each wrong answer, one life point is lost.

In each history periode, there is also an enemy card, representing an evil character or event in history. Each enemy has a printed value. When reaching such an enemy, the active player may try to defeat the enemy. For that purposes he bid a number of hour glass tokens and throws a ten sided die (values 0 through 9). The number thrown is then multiplied by the number of hour glasses bid and if that number is equal or higher than the enemies value, the enemy is defeated and life points are gained. Otherwise the enemey card remains on the board and three life points are lost.

Players win the game when all six enemies are defeated or they lose the game when they have no more life points left.

Name: Swear Jar
Description:
Remember the days when your parent's or job made you put money in a swear jar everytime you ended up using curse words?

Now play the game inspired from all the times you lost your money to the jar. Match colors or values in the fast paced game while trying to get your Swear Jar built up before someone plays a dirty word.

No Actual Foul Language is used in the game.

Each player is dealt 5 cards. Each turn a player draws a card and must place a card in their swear jar. Cards must match either the color or the value of the top card of their current swear jar. If a Swear Card is played the banks are removed and added into the players scoring pile. Once all cards in the deck have been played the round is over and scores are added up. Cards are reshuffled and play continues until a player reaches
500 points.

Name: 71 grader nord
Description:
This game is based on the Norwegian reality TV Show "71 grader nord", where a number of participants hike from Norways south most point "Lindesnes" to the North Cape.

From the publishers website (translated from Norwegian language):
"Who achieves the most victories on the way to the North Cape?

Finaly the board game is here, which lets us all attend the exhausting tour from Lindesnes to the North Cape.

The aim of the game is to answer right to most of the questions in the course of ten stages and gain  stage victories, which you can take with you on your way to the North.

Here you can show your knowledge of Norway. All from geography and history to famouse peoples and curiosities is includet. And, like in the TV show, it is possible for you to use a map as help, if your strengh lies not in geography.

If you are lucky you can get an extra round, where you can get full three points if you are fast. The questions on the cards are classified in easy, medium and difficult, and so they can created total unpredictable situations.

Are your the next to be winner of 71 grader nord?

Content: board, map, gaming pieces, dices, 200 cards with questions, 100 bonus cards, free card, point counters, winner counters, card counters, hour glass and Norwegian rules."

Name: Cuarenta
Description:
From Wikipedia ( http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cuarenta )

Cuarenta is the national card game of Ecuador. It is a fishing game played with a Baraja, a pack of 40 Spanish playing cards. The game can also be played with the standard 52 card pack of Anglo-American playing cards, but all 10s, 9s and 8s are omitted (ace is low).

Cuarenta is Spanish for the number 40. This refers to the number of points that are required to win a chica (small division of the game) and also to the number of cards used to play it. Two chicas or the first chica with zapatería (loss of the chica by scoring less than ten points) win the game (a completed game is called a "mesa", which means "match"). The game can be played by 2 players, or 4 players split into two teams.

Five cards are dealt to each player, given out as a batch of five cards at a time. Each player plays one card face up onto the table. Cards on the table may be captured by the opponent. If cards are captured, they are placed face down in front of the player or his teammate. Played cards remain on the table until they are captured or the round ends.

Cards can be captured in the following three ways: matching (card same rank as on the table; player places matching card onto own pile), addition  (two cards add to the value of the other; a 2 and a 4 can be captured by a 6; an ace, a 2 and a 4 can be captured by a 7; cards with pictures have no value and cannot be captured this way), and sequence (a card captured by matching or addition entitles the picking of the next higher card; matching a 2 entitles the capturing of the 3 and 4 (etc.), as well, should there be any).

If a player clears the table by capturing all cards, they score a limpia. If a player captures the card just played by the player before, this is called a caída. In either case, the player scores 2 points.

Before the first individual turn after each deal, special announcements have to be made by each player if applicable. These are the doble ronda (four cards of the same rank) and the ronda (three cards of the same rank). A doble ronda  automatically wins the game; a ronda scores two points. After all five cards are played, there is a new deal. After all cards have been played (2 deals with 4 players, 4 deals with 2 players), each player or team counts their collected cards. If the number of collected cards is 20, 6 points are scored; an additional point is given for each captured card in excess of 20, rounded to the next even number.

A chica is won when a player or team reaches 40 points. The game is won when a player or a team wins two chicas or when the opponent doesn't reach ten points at the end of the first chica.

Name: Assideum
Description:
From the box:

Welcome to a world of the Imagination
Where subtle, yet cunning decisions pave the way to Victory

In this time of peril, your most trusted and elite Forces have heard your call to Battle.  As you watch them assemble, you recall the previous Victories were gained through intelligence and a keen sense of strategy.  Explore every option, then choose your course of action - but, remember, your opponent will be doing the same...

Tactics must be used which recognize the strengths and weaknesses of your opponent's battle forces, as well as your own.  Slow-moving ground forces can successfully defend key sectors of the Battle Grid, while swift-moving ground forces race through alley-ways to the attack.  But always be aware of the power of the air forces and the Ranger which, when skillfully positioned, can be devastating.

Now, it is time to clear your mind so that you can imagine the impossible.  Be prepared to change course in a heartbeat, yet always keep the ultimate goal firmly in mind.  You are ready.

Play:  Players execute one option per turn and alternate turns until victory is attained.  The battle forces consist of the army under the command of a player.  Siege occurs when you can attack your opponent's commander on your next turn.  Victory is attained when your opponent cannot excape siege.  Opening setup is similar in look to a chess game, and each individual type of fighter is able to move in a different way.  The fighters include both ground and flying forces.

Ground forces can be positioned by movement, or in certain cases through spinning, or through BOTH spinning and movement.  Flying forces can fly in the flight zone established by the ground forces (portals).

Name: Seven of Seven
Description:
Seven of Seven (S.o.S.) is a card game that has seven different ways to play! The main concept has to do with conflicts among Eternals which are divided in Archangels, Demons, Fortune Gods and Mortals which divided in the Sages of Ancient Greece and the Sages of China.
Each player is a Supreme Being which tries to manipulate mortals with the help of Eternals. Also, to make things more interests, you use the Seven Heavenly Virtues and Seven Deadly Sins to help in this endeavor.
In the end, the Seven Wonders help to take advantage of cards that already being used, for a small price. The Wonder is given to an opponent, and at the end of the game, the opponent benefits from the Wonders given to him.
But that's just for the first variation of the game!

The titles of the Seven of games of Seven are as follows:


     Seven Supreme
     Epta (by the greek number of Seven.)
     Triptych
     Revenge of Mortals
     Iris
     Heaven vs Hell
     Voidance


Also, you might have understood by now, that all the cards in
this game are related to the number Seven. So, here's a list of
the games components:

     7 Sages of Ancient Greece
     7 Sages of China
     7 Archangels
     7 Demons
     7 Fortune Gods
     7 Heavenly Virtues
     7 Deadly Sins
     7 Wonders
     1 Justice


Total of 57 cards.

Name: UFO Interception: Roswell 1947
Description:
This aerial combat game allows players to fight for control of the sky over New Mexico. Players can choose to fly the classic piston-engine P-51D Mustang or the Roswell UFO over the desert. This is the first game in their "UFO Interception" series.

UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 (Standard Set) contains UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 Rulebook, Roswell UFO + base (1/285 Scale), P-51D Mustang + base (1/285 Scale), various Templates, Dice and Reference Cards.

UFO Interception: Roswell 1947 (Limited Edition of 600 copies) also included a 4'x4' desert play map, an extra "Mogul" balloon mini and a "Crashed Roswell UFO" mini.

Name: Foxhole: Utah Beach
Description:
Foxhole is a series of board wargames planned to cover a number of important battles of World War II and later those of other wars from the Napoleonic Wars to the War on Terror. Players assume the roles of Divisional or Corps  commander. Although there are other ways to play the game, in the historical scenarios the goal is not to "win", but rather to do better than the historical commanders whose role the players have overtaken. The series' scale encompasses both the Operational and Tactical  levels. Although the product is a wargame its publishers prefer to call it a simulation. It is developed by game designer Glenn Davis and published by Diffraction Entertainment, Ltd. based in Scotland, UK.

Foxhole's first product Utah Beach can be played by two to six players, while future installments are to allow additional players.

The product comes with three ways to play the game: 
1) The historical scenario that comes with each product where the goal is to do better than the historical results, 
2) A competitive (called tournament-style in the rulebook) system with over two dozen orders similar to Warhammer 40k like sieze and hold, rearguard action, etc. where your goal is to "beat" your opponent to the goal.  Interestingly, in this version you each take one of the hexagonally shaped maps, set up your forces, and then push them together, giving you a bit of fog of war.  
3) TSWW conversion: Although seemingly not fully supported in the original product, the rulebook implies that with later releases of TO&E data players will be able to play out TSWW battles at the Foxhole scale, giving gamers the first opportunity ever to play out World War II at the company scale ... everywhere.

As for playing the game; the following is ripped straight from the rulebook: "A Primer on Foxhole™ in 400 Words or Less
Each Player Turn consists of 6 essential Phases:

    Supply-Movement Phase: Units which are adjacent to enemies, plan on firing an artillery barrage or conduct an Activity this turn must Trace Supply instead of do anything this Phase.  Otherwise they may move as usual.
    Barrage Phase: Barrages may be fired this Turn by Sorties and Artillery.  In the case of Artillery, they must have Traced Supply in the prior Phase and not move in the next in order to do so.  Note that the Reacting Player may also be able to fire Barrages.
    Activities-Movement Phase: It is during this Phase and only if the Unit Traced Supply in the Supply-Movement Phase that Units may conduct Activities other than Movement such as digging entrenchments, demolishing them, bridges, etc., crossing a river or un-pin a Vehicle Platoon (which represents Vehicles bogged down).  Units may also move unless they fired a Barrage in the prior Phase.
    Combat Phase: There are two kinds of Combat and each hex may be attacked only once.  Assaulting allows Units to enter and, if successful, secure a hex.  Its disadvantages are that it allows the opposing Player to make Covering Fire against your Assaulting Units, you have less terrain benefits and are limited to 4 Units Assaulting the Hex.  By contrast, Fights allow Units to attack enemy Units from range and has none of the above hindrances, but cannot secure a Hex and is less likely to do serious damage to the opposition.
    Motorized Movement Phase: Motorized Units are all Vehicle Platoons plus any other Unit with the little wheels at the bottom.  Any of such Units can move during this Phase.  In lieu of moving, they may instead make a 50/50 attempt to Un-pin themselves from the hex (but they couldn't have moved anyway).
    Vehicle Assault Phase: During this Phase Vehicles Platoons (not all Motorized Units) may make Assaults.
    Full Turn: A Full Turn consists of Weather Determination and Forecasting followed by a Player Turn from each Player.  The Offensive Player always goes first, which is also the Allied Player in the Utah Beach Historical Scenario.  There are three Full Turns each Day representing the Morning, Afternoon and Night.  Preceding each Morning Turn and the beginning of the day both Players should conduct a Dawn Briefing." - Foxhole Rulebook, page 36.


The only thing the above misses is a fun little weather forecasting and resolution where players forecast the weather two turns ahead of time, and it may or may not actually end up being the weather they thought it was going to be (but *probably* will), adding a lot a pressure/tenseness as the commanders look overhead to see whether those clouds will clear up, start a drizzle, or remain overcast as predicted.

Name: Het Nationale Ballet Spel
Description:
A trivia game with the Dutch National Ballet theme.

Each player gets a jurysurvey card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a quetion in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the jurysurvey card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the jurysurvey card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Name: Baobab Reisspel
Description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

MAde for the travel company Baobab.

Name: The Party Game
Description:
There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she receives a Right-chip. Otherwise he/she receives a Wrong-chip.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

A trivia game about fashion, dances, music and Bacardi.

Name: Playboy The Game
Description:
Each player gets a Playboy card. There are 6 different categories. The player start his/her turn with throwing the die and move the pawn in the direction the player wants. The player has to answer a question in the category he or she lands on. If the player answers the question correctly, he/she places a Right-chip on the Playboy card. Otherwise he/she places a Wrong-chip on the Playboy card.
When a player has collected 6 chips, the game ends. The player with the most Right-chips, wins the game.

Trivia game about the World of Playboy.

Name: Step Chain: Expansion Set
Description:
The Step Chain Expansion adds a fourth color into play and also includes a new type of  card that allows you to split your chain into multiple chains, giving you more options for scoring and blocking.
Source: [ The Game Crafter].

The expansion set really completes the game adding yellow into the mix.  A total of 80 cards are added including the new Split Chain Cards offer more options on building chains and some interesting scoring possibilities if you can merge your chains back together.

Name: Polemos: Risorgimento
Description:
User Summary:
Polemos: Risorgimento is a free to download miniature ruleset supplement to Polemos: Franco-Prussian War covering the Italian Wars of unification.

Two sizes of games are presented. The Risorgimento Fratelli d'Italia focuses on smaller scale actions with corps sized forces. One base of miniatures is to represent an infantry battalion of approximately 500 soldiers. For players who prefer army scale games Risorgimento Feldzeugmeister is the other part of the game. In Feldzeugmeister one base of miniatures represent brigades, approximately 2500 soldiers in the case of infantry.

The game is available from Baccus6mm in the U.K.

Name: Das Grosse Hilton Spiel
Description:
From the rules:
'The object of this exciting game is to become the greatest possible owner of Hilton Hotels. In pursuit of this goal a little optimistic speculation is as important as being lucky at dicing.'

Similar to Monopoly, you roll a die, move, then take/add to a hotel or take a card if you land on the right space.

Name: Hexadoms
Description:
Dominoes variant played using hexagonal pieces.
The pieces are divided equally amongst the players and a start player chosen. The start player places one of their hexadoms, Second play must place on of their pieces matching one of the sides. Subsequent players must place matching two or more sides.
If a player cannot place a piece they miss a turn. Play continues until one player has placed all his Hexadoms - they are the winner. If no player can place a Hexadom then the player whose pieces show the fewest dots is the winner.

Name: World at War: Paris is Burning
Description:
From the website... "The Soviets have broken through the NATO line in West Germany, and the West German, British, and Americans are in full retreat. They approach the French border, hoping for aid, praying for sanctuary, but the AMX-30 tanks on the far side of the border fire, their shells ripping into the approaching NATO troops. Thus starts another chapter in the World at War series.

Paris is Burning brings the French into the flaming battlefields of Europe. Zealots, patriots, and determined to defend their homeland, the French battle any army that crosses into France. Paris is Burning ships with two 11" x 17" geomorphic maps, 176 eye-popping counters, player’s aids, and module rules, all tucked neatly into an attractive box. Paris is Burning is an expansion for World at War: The Untold Stories.

This expansion includes:

     Two 11" x 17" geomorphic mounted maps.
     176 counters depicting French, British, Americans, and the evil Soviets.
     Player aid card.
     Module rules.
     Vividly illustrated box.
Families: Series: World at War (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: ZynVaded!
Description:
From website:

ZynVaded!™ is a tabletop miniatures game unlike any you’ve likely seen before, because you literally fight battles on a table top (or desktop, or counter-top, etc.)! In it, you assume the role of one faction of the Zyn, an inch-high, insectile alien race determined to 
conquer our planet, one cluttered surface at a time!  You can choose to play as either the Kyll’al, the militant arm of the alien invasion, or the Sav’m, the  rebellious faction looking to halt the invasion.

Players control small teams of 28mm miniature aliens, usually 3 or so figures per side, one Leader, one Support and one Scout or Assassin. These figures represent the alien factions fighting to either get a foothold on Earth or to stop the invasion.  Since these figures represent inch high aliens the battle field can be your desktop, itchen table, or any suitable surface, using what ever happens to be there as terain to give your figures cover as as they battle.

Figures are given stats such as Speed, Melee Combat, Ranged Combat and Body Points (hit points) and can have special abilities.  Combat is D10 based and rules allow close combat and ranged combat.  Players roll against each other for initiatie each turn.  The winner gets to use each figures action points to perform move or combat actions.  Once done the next player does the same.

Playsheets are included.  Players use these to track the status of their figures, one per sheet.

There are simple campaign rules allowing figures to gain special abilities or improve their stats over a course of several games.

Play is scenario based and each side is given objectives, the winner is the side to first complete their objectives or alternately the last side standing.  Scenarios can be found on the publiher's web forum.

The game comes with six figures, two Stat Card sheets (which may be copied and should also be available on the publisher's website), two pencils, two 10-sided dice, one measuring tape and the rules.

Name: Alle alle
Description:
Players take turns rolling 1-6 dice. Beginning with a 1, all consecutive dice (i.e. 1,2,3 etc) are stacked up in the middle. After 6, the 1 is stacked on top. Dice which can't be used have to be taken back. If the stack topples, the guilty player has to take all the dice. The first player to run out of dice is the winner.

The game was sold in a dice bag.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: Frag Gold Edition: FTW
Description:
Frag is about blowing stuff up. This expansion brings you new things to blow up, new weapons to blow them up with, and new places to do it.

Arm yourself with the Assault Shotgun and the Shock Glove. Fight across two new maps, with lava and water terrain . . . either one can link to the gameboard from Frag Gold Edition for nearly ten square feet of arena! Blow up barrels and set off a chain reaction. Doors that open the Frag way . . . you have to shoot at the switch! And new scenarios, including the classic Last Man Standing.

More weapons, more hazards, more targets. More . . . FTW!

Name: The Greatest Invasion in History
Description:
Desk top publishing from TDF.

The game covers the whole season of "Ultraseven" TV series.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultraseven

The invasion player controls all of the aliens which appeared in the TV series.  He can get the cards from the deck then allocate his action points to place the alien, and proceed its invasion.
If the invasion comes to the determined amount, then it must be revealed and could be farther proceeded.

The Seven player can search hidden invasion by placing TDF members in each area.  Once the invasion is revealed, he can attack them with TDF members or Ultraseven.

The game continues until the invasion succeeds or all invasion are destroyed by the Seven player.

10 sheets of cards
rulebook
markers

Name: Race World
Description:
A simple pseudo-collectible card game supplied with each Hot Wheels car as part of the backing. The card when cut out shows on the front the car and on the back the cars three statistics: Horsepower, Speed and Accelleration 0-60. The stat is followed by a rating bar of 1-5 and then a numerical value. The card also lists the cars data, which do not have any impact on the game. When it was Born, Designer, Birthplace and Speciality which is a short description of the cars functions.

Gameplay is as follows.
Challenge a friend - 1: Choose one of the three categories. 2: Highest number wins. 3: Race the cars in the case of a tie.

Re-implements:

    Top Trumps

Name: The Charge
Description: A "Tokalon"  series game about Teddy Roosevelt leading the charge up San Juan Hill in the Spanish American War. A simple roll and move game. Getting to the top of the hill before the Spanish have the opportunity to react and stop you by interferring with your avenue of attack.

Name: Meeple Feast
Description: A dexterity/flicking game descended from the likes of Elchfest.  Flick ice floes for your polar bear to walk on and race your opponent's polar bear to be the first to eat your own meeples and the neutral meeple standing on ice floes in the center.

Name: Watch on de Rind
Description:
An ethnic and inappropriate 'Black Memorabilia'  ball toss game from 1931 produced by All-Fair Games
 The box was set up on a table top and the object was to throw a ball into the mouth or hats of a number of Black caricatures who are seen eating and standing around a large watermelon. Points were scored for landing in the targets.

Name: Brandenburg
Description:
Before the German blitzkrieg stormed across Europe in 1939-40, a group of elite soldiers prepared the way by seizing bridges and other strategic targets ahead of the attack. In the following years, these warrior-spies, known as the Brandenburgers, operated behind enemy lines around the globe, from Russia and Yugoslavia to Egypt, Iraq, and India, Often bending the rules of war while completing their daring covert missions. Trained to be mobile and independent, steeped in foreign languages and customs, and expert in numerous military specialties, the Brandenburgers influenced the world's special forces long after World War II.

Brandenburg is a tactical wargame for up to three players, depicting the actions of the German commando force throughout the entire WWII. The game's map is assembled using hexagonal tiles, a method which simulates the fog of war and increases the game's replayability over time. Counters represent individual units, with specialized infantry (soldiers, medics, engineers, scouts and snipers) able to pack, equip and use a wide variety of weapons and gear to carry out their missions. Civilians, agents and partisans populate the conflict zone, acting as influential factors capable of tilting the balance of power to either side's favor.

Name: SAVAS
Description:
SAVAS is a dynamic, diplomatic, war-like strategy game. Each stylized deck comes with 17 numbered cards in 4 different colors of elegant artistry. The challenge is to overpower the other players without drawing too much attention to yourself. Manage your defenses and economy as you make and break alliances to come out on top.

SAVAS is easy to learn and rich with player interaction. Start with a humble hand of 6 to 10 cards, and, if you keep your wits sharp, you might survive. Hold on tight, because in this game you will need every card your deck can spare to bring down your opponents!
